nodes.name: Dataset Structured
nodes.description: This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc. The dataset has been defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.
nodes.details:
This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc.

The data has been defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: dataset
fields.title: Dataset
fields.description: Selected Dataset

nodes.name: Print N Rows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output
nodes.details:
This node is used to print incoming dataset.

Number of rows that needs to be printed can be configured in the node.

fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

fields.title: Display Data Type
fields.description: If true display rows DataType

nodes.name: Cast To Single Type
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame by casting the specified input columns to a new data type
nodes.details:
This node creates a new DataFrame by casting the specified input columns to a new data type. All the selected columns would be cast to the specified data type.

The boolean field Replace Existing Columns indicates whether the existing column should be replaced or a new column should be created.
nodes.examples:
If incoming Dataframe has following columns with below specified datatype:

  • CUST_ID : Integer
  • CUST_NAME : String
  • DOB : Datetime
  • AGE : Integer
and [DOB] and [AGE] are selected for casting to [STRING] datatype then outgoing Dataframe would have below datatypes:

  • CUST_ID : Integer
  • CUST_NAME : String
  • DOB : String
  • AGE : String

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: inputCols
fields.title: Columns
fields.description: Columns to be cast to new data type

fields.name: outputColType
fields.title: New Data Type
fields.description: New data type for the selected columns (INTEGER, DOUBLE, STRING, LONG, SHORT)

fields.name: replaceExistingCols
fields.title: Replace Existing Cols?
fields.description: Whether to replace existing columns or create new ones?

nodes.name: Cast To Different Types-1
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame by casting the specified columns into new types
nodes.details:
This node creates a new DataFrame by casting the specified columns into new types.

Option to replace existing column or create a new column after conversion can be selected in the node.
nodes.examples:
Incoming Dataframe has following rows:

INV_NO | INV_DATE | INV_AMT
----------------------------------------------------
STRING | STRING | STRING
----------------------------------------------------
INV001 | 2010-12-28 | 1000.0
INV002 | 2020-10-15 | 1500.0
INV003 | 2010-01-01 | 100.0

if MultiCastColumnType node is configured to perform conversions as below:

COLUMNS | NEW DATA TYPE | REPLACE EXISTING COLS
--------------------------------------------------------------
INV_DATE | DATE | false
INV_DATE | LONG | false

then new columns would be added in outgoing Dataframe as below after conversion:

INV_NO | INV_DATE | INV_AMT | INV_DATE-new | INV_AMT-new
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
STRING | STRING | STRING | DATE | LONG
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
INV001 | 2010-12-28 | 1000.0 | 2010-12-28 | 1000
INV002 | 2020-10-15 | 1500.0 | 2020-10-15 | 1500
INV003 | 2010-01-01 | 100.0 | 2010-01-01 | 100

CAST TO DIFFERENT TYPES -1:

Use this node when we have to convert multiple input data type to the different output data type Ex: Cast an integer data type column to double data type, Cast string datat ype to Boolean
